0.Pros: It wasn't bad for a high school kid
0.Cons: Low pay, can be very stressful during rushes.

1.Pros: the people are fun to work with and friendly

2.Pros: Discounted meal during shift.Meet great people
2.Cons: Rude customersShift management lazyNo real organizationCan't stand in one spot

3.Pros: There is nothing really good to say about working here it's a kid job nothing more nothing less.
3.Cons: Busy on weekends annoying manegment and inexperienced really nothing good comes out it is a really bad company

4.Pros: fun sometimes cool but annoying people

5.Pros: I love my job because no day is ever the same. Each day I am presented with new challenges and situations, which really helps me to stay focused and interested. I also enjoy being able to be as creative as I can.
5.Cons: Bad hours. I can recall moments I would wake up stressed, bored, and unmotivated. There was no passion or drive, I didn't feel myself improving.

6.Pros: You become great at multi-tasking. Costumer service may improve because you're going to deal with really rude costumers and you're going to learn how to handle a bad situation well.
6.Cons: Cons of working here would be the possibility of getting your hours cut randomly and then getting no days off. Also costumers can really push your buttons some days.

7.Pros: Quick simple training. Great benefits. Loved it!
7.Cons: Stigma of working at fast food

8.Pros: Great coworkers, friendly environment, free meal per day is also a plus. Really easy job, literally anyone can do it, that's why they might hire you!
8.Cons: Inefficient system, management is to blind to see it. When it gets busy we are not prepared at all, yet it gets busy almost all the time. Need new management

9.Pros: Flexible schedule, opportunities for becoming managers
9.Cons: Relatively low pay, the smell of fast food can make it difficult to eat enough
